metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4415 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in systemd. This security flaw can cause a local information leak due to systemd-coredump not respecting the fs.suid_dumpable kernel setting.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4415` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
libnss-mymachines - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
libnss-resolve - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
libnss-systemd - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
libpam-systemd - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
libsystemd-shared - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
libsystemd0 - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
libudev1 - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-boot - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-boot-efi - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-container - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-coredump - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-homed - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-journal-remote - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-oomd - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-resolved - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-standalone-sysusers - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-standalone-tmpfiles - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-sysv - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-tests - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-timesyncd - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
systemd-userdbd - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
udev - 251.4-1ubuntu7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '251.4-1ubuntu7.1').
